thread.title: Is LeBron James’ back going to be issue from now on?
thread.title_full: Is LeBron James’ back going to be issue from now on? | New York Post

author: Post Wire Report
title: Is LeBron James’ back going to be issue from now on?
text:
LeBron James received another injection into his troubled back this week, sources told Ohio.com, marking a pattern of physical breakdown for the soon-to-be 31-year-old megastar.
James first received an anti-inflammatory shot in January during a two-week shutdown last season. He emerged from that hiatus to lead the Cavaliers within two wins of the NBA title.
Though the back problems are a recurring issue, the website reported it’s not seen as a “significant issue.”
Cavaliers coach David Blatt had dropped hints Thursday, saying James might not play for the remainder of the preseason — games Sunday in Toronto and at home Monday against Dallas. James played in just two of the first five preseason games.
“We’ll see what happens at the beginning of next week,” Blatt said. “I certainly don’t expect him to play both games and I don’t know if he’ll even play one. We’ll see.
“We want to take good care of him for the start of the season. As you know in his great and storied career, he has amassed a lot of miles. We’re trying to keep those preseason miles to a minimum.”
The Cavaliers open the regular season at the Bulls on Oct. 27.
With AP 
  cleveland cavaliers ,  lebron james
